titlestmt.titleproper: Finding aid for the Walter Jurmann papers, [1910]-1995 LSC.2271
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Juliane Brand, 1989; collection reprocessed by Melissa Haley, 2015; machine-readable finding aid created by Caroline Cubé.

p.date: ©2004 The Regents of the University of California. All rights reserved.

address.addressline: Room A1713, Charles E. Young Research Library

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2022-09-06 10:33:57 -0700.

did.unittitle: Walter Jurmann papers

physdesc.extent: (6 document boxes, 3 small flat boxes, and 1 large flat box)

did.abstract: Collection consists of material related to career of the composer Walter Jurmann, including scores, lyrics, business and personal papers, correspondence, photographs, and biographic items.
did.physloc: Stored off-site. All requests to access special collections material must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.
did.langmaterial: The bulk of material is in English, with numerous song scores and other items in German. Several scores are in French, one in Hungarian.

accessrestrict.head: Restrictions on Access
accessrestrict.p: Open for research. All requests to access special collections materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: CONTAINS AUDIO MATERIALS: This collection contains processed audio materials. Audio materials in this collection are restricted and require advance notice for use. All requests to access digital materials must be made in advance using the request button located on this page.

userestrict.head: Restrictions on Use and Reproduction
userestrict.p: Property rights to the objects belong to UCLA Library Special Collections. All other rights, including copyright, are retained by the creators and their heirs. It is the responsibility of the researcher to determine who holds the copyright and pursue the copyright owner or his or her heir for permission to publish where The UC Regents do not hold the copyright.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Walter Jurmann Papers (Collection 2271). UCLA Library Special Collections, Charles E. Young Research Library, University of California, Los Angeles.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Collections are processed to a variety of levels depending on the work necessary to make them usable, their perceived user interest and research value, availability of staff and resources, and competing priorities. Library Special Collections provides a standard level of preservation and access for all collections and, when time and resources permit, conducts more intensive processing. These materials have been arranged and described according to national and local standards and best practices.

We are committed to providing ethical, inclusive, and anti-racist description of the materials we steward, and to remediating existing description of our materials that contains language that may be offensive or cause harm. We invite you to submit feedback about how our collections are described, and how they could be described more accurately, by filling out the form located on our website: Report Potentially Offensive Description in Library Special Collections.

bioghist.head: Biographical note
bioghist.p: Composer Walter Jurmann was born October 12, 1903, in Vienna, Austria. He began his career as a piano player in Austria and in 1927 moved to Berlin, where he became a pianist at the Eden Hotel. During his time in Berlin, Jurmann collaborated with the lyricist Fritz Rotter (1900-1984) and the Polish composer Bronislaw Kaper (1902-1983), creating a number of hit songs. In the early 1930s, Jurmann and Kaper also wrote songs for German and French films, and Jurmann wrote revues during a stay in Paris in 1933. He sometimes issued music under pseudonyms while working in Europe.

In 1934, Louis B. Mayer recruited Jurmann and Kaper for MGM's film productions, bringing them to Los Angeles. The pair wrote songs for the Marx Brothers' A Night at the Opera and A Day at the Races, and the films The Mutiny on the Bounty, Escapade, and San Francisco. Jurmann also composed music for several songs in the Judy Garland musical Presenting Lily Mars. By the mid-1940s, Jurmann had left the film industry, becoming a freelance composer. He later wrote a number of love songs, as well as songs for the cities of San Antonio, Houston, and Los Angeles. Jurmann died on June 17, 1971, while traveling in Budapest, Hungary.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Collection consists of material related to the career of composer Walter Jurmann including scores, lyrics, business and personal papers, correspondence, and photographs. Scores are primarily songs for films and popular songs in English and German. Also included are posthumous articles, clippings, programs, and other items concerning Jurmann's music. Much of collection, especially biographic material and some scores, was compiled by Jurmann's wife Yvonne Jurmann after his death.

arrangement.head: Organization and Arrangement
arrangement.p: The collection is arranged into the following series: Series 1. Scores; Series 2. Lyrics; Series 3. Business and personal papers; Series 4. Correspondence; Series 5. Photographs; Series 6. Biographic material; Series 7. Sound recordings; Series 8. Ephemera.

did.unittitle: Series 1. Scores

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Scores are primarily published versions, though some manuscript and holograph scores, as well as reproductions, are present. Songs are arranged alphabetically by title in most subseries. Dates provided are usually copyright date of published version.

did.unittitle: Subseries 1. Songs for film

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Scores for film songs are arranged alphabetically by film title. In most cases film titles are followed by the song title(s), then lyricist and composer. Items are in English, German, French, and Hungarian.

Series 3. Business and personal papers

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Series contains legal documents, which include contracts, agreements, and certificates of copyright relating to Jurmann's musical compositions. Also present are U.S., Austrian, and French passports and identity cards and international drivers permits; U.S. army records; honorary citizen and member certificates; and notes.
Scripts, screenplays, plot synopses, lyrics, and other material relating to Jurmann's film and theater work, especially the musical Windy City, are also included.

did.unittitle: Notes
Legal documents
Identity records
U.S. Army records
Honors
Scripts

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: The scripts, drafts, outlines, and lyrics for the musical Windy City (screenplay/story by Philip Yordan, lyrics by Pual Francis Webster, music by Jurmann) also include its other titles The Honest Gambler, Danny Boy, Heads or Tails, and Of Him and Her.

The Secret Singer, by Ann Watermann
The Secret Singer, by Walter Jurmann
The Third from the Left, by Ladislas Fodor (2 copies)
Windy City
Series 4. Correspondence

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Correspondence of Walter Jurmann, his wife Yvonne Jurmann, and between others primarily concerns Jurmann's songs San Francisco and San Antonio. Also present are copies and drafts of letters Jurmann sent to U.S. presidents with responses. Jurmann family postcards, most of which are photographic portraits, include those sent by Jurmann and his brother Otto as well as two sent by Jurmann' s father Norbert to the family of his brother-in-law, Rudolf Fischer.
Correspondence regarding specific contracts are located with the legal documents in Series 2.

did.unittitle: Walter Jurmann
Yvonne Jurmann
Regarding Walter Jurmann
Jurmann family postcards
Series 5. Photographs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Primarily consists of photographs of Jurmann, his wife Yvonne Jurmann, and the Jurmann family. Also included are group photographs containing Jurmann, and a few images of other individuals, landscapes, and Jurmann's gravestone.

The identification of persons of some photographs was presumably made by Yvonne Jurmann (in pencil on reverse). See Jurmann family postcards in Series 4 for further photos of the family. Negatives were created by UCLA's Music Library from images of existing photographs and other items in the collection.

did.unittitle: Walter Jurmann
Yvonne Jurmann
Walter and Yvonne Jurmann
Jurmann family
Group photographs
Others
Landscapes
Gravestone
Negatives
Series 6. Biographic material

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Consists of articles, newspaper clippings, and other material about Jurmann's music and career. Much of this material was collected by Jurmann's wife, Yvonne Jurmann, and concerns posthumous events or press. Many items are in German.

did.unittitle: Articles
Lists of works and discographies
Radio and television programs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Consists of announcements, listings, scripts and production material relating to posthumous radio and television programs about Jurmann or featuring his music.

did.unittitle: Programs

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Programs are primarily for posthumous concerts and festivals. Several are for events in San Antonio (folder 4).

did.unittitle: Clippings

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Most clippings are housed in disbound scrapbooks and primarily concern Jurmann's official city songs for Houston, San Antonio, and San Francisco.

did.unittitle: Resolutions

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: City resolutions regarding the songs San Antonio and San Francisco.

did.unittitle: Series 7. Sound recordings

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Includes two German 33 1/3 LPs of Jurmann's songs (box 9); 45s of the songs A Better World to Live In, Houston, San Antonio (English and Spanish versions), and Wien ist wieder Wien/ Mein schönes Wien (box 8); and a German cassette Autoren Porträts Walter Jurmann (box 8).

phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: RESTRICTED ACCESS: Use of audio material requires production of listening copies.

did.unittitle: Series 8. Ephemera
San Antonio tourism material
Man of Montmartre by Stephen and Ethel Longstreet (book, galley proofs)
Jurmann promotional ephemera

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Primarily consists of press releases, promotional ephemera, and graphic design layouts pertaining to Jurmann's official city songs for Houston, San Antonio, and San Francisco. Also included is an autographed poster for a posthumous concert of Jurmann's music.

did.unittitle: Press releases and ephemera
Graphics
Poster
